Ambient Flow

The number of networked “smart devices” available in everyday environments is rapidly increasing. However, most adopt mutually incompatible networks, protocols, and application programming interfaces.

Ambient Flow provides a set of novel smart space design tools, which enable non-programmers to visually “remix” their ambient environments in new, playful and potentially unforeseen ways using an intuitive flow-graph model.


Publications :

  • D. Carlson, M. Mogerle, M. Pagel, S. Verma, and D. S. Rosenblum, “Ambient flow: A visual approach for remixing the internet of things” in 5th International Conference on Internet of Things (IoT 2015)
    [Full Paper]

  • D. Carlson, M. Mogerle, M. Pagel, S. Verma, and D. S. Rosenblum, “A Visual Design Toolset for Drag-and-drop Smart Space Configuration” in 5th International Conference on Internet of Things (IoT 2015)
    [Demo Paper]

Awards :

  • Best Demo Award at the 5th International Conference on the Internet of Things (IoT 2015)
